docTitle.titlePart:
Support for Resource Availability Indication Over
SIP Trunks

front.note:
First Published: July 09, 2010
Last Updated: July 21, 2010
front.div:
The Support for Monitoring Utilization of Critical Resources on Gateway Router
, Cisco UBE and Cisco
UCME and Reporting Over SIP Trunks feature implements monitoring of resource utilization and
reporting functionality over the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) trunk on the Cisco IOS gateway, Cisco
Unified Border Element (Cisco UBE) and Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express (Cisco
UCME). This feature supports monitoring of CPU, memory, Digital Signaling Processor (DSP) and the
DS0 port on the Cisco IOS gateway and reporting the status to external devices using SIP OPTION
mechanism.
Finding Feature Information
Your software release may not support all the features documented in this module. For the latest feature
information and caveats, see the release notes for your platform and software release. To find information
about the features documented in this module, and to see a list of the releases in which each feature is
supported, see the "Feature Information for the Support for Resource Availability Indication Over SIP
Trunks" section on page 10.
Use Cisco Feature Navigator to find information about platform support and Cisco software image
support. To access Cisco Feature Navigator, go to
http://www.cisco.com/go/cfn. An account on
Cisco.com is not required.
